title: Bachelorette producers are in 'crisis mode' over Matt's romance with Jessika Power
text:
He was an early favourite to win Angie Kent's heart on The Bachelorette.

But Matt Whyatt has seemingly confirmed he doesn't win the show after he was caught in public with MAFS star Jessika Power last month.

According Woman's Day, Bachelorette producers have been scrambling to 'contain' the relationship as part of a wider strategy to cover up spoilers.

Reports: The Bachelorette producers are reportedly in 'crisis mode' as they desperately try to hide Matt Whyatt's relationship with MAFS star Jessika Power while he's still on the show

Meanwhile, the magazine also reported that Jessika and Matt's relationship is getting serious and he 'has even introduced his family to her'.

In September, the reality TV lovebirds 'spent the night' together after hooking up in a Gold Coast nightclub.

Multiple sources confirmed to Daily Mail Australia that the pair, both 27, flirted up a storm inside the YOT Club, before leaving together and going back to Matt's place.

Heating up: In September, the reality TV lovebirds 'spent the night' together after hooking up in a Gold Coast nightclub

'They were all over each other in their private booth, they didn't care who saw them,' said an onlooker.

Matt is still vying for Angie Kent's heart on The Bachelorette, but Daily Mail Australia understand he doesn't win the show.

It comes after Jessika recently downplayed her relationship with the BMX rider.

So much for keeping a low profile! Matt is still vying for Angie Kent's (right) heart on The Bachelorette, but Daily Mail Australia understand he doesn't win the show

She wrote on Instagram last month: 'Just to clear up some of the articles that have come out this weekend speculating that I have a romantic relationship with Matt - he and I are friends and share the same mutual friend groups.

'We all enjoy catching up for a drink and a laugh so any other rumours of us dating right now are false and misleading.'

The Bachelorette continues Wednesday at 7:30pm on Channel 10
description: According Woman's Day, Bachelorette producers have been scrambling to 'contain' the relationship as part of a wider strategy to cover up spoilers
authors: David Wu For Daily Mail Australia
